title: FRQ Comparison of CH4 and CCl4

content.question: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.Answer the following questions about <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C C l 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The Lewis electron-dot diagrams for molecules of the compounds are shown above.(a) Which compound has the higher boiling point? Justify your answer. The type(s) of intermolecular force(s) in both substances should be included in your answer.

frqParts.text: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.Answer the following questions about <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C C l 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The Lewis electron-dot diagrams for molecules of the compounds are shown above.(a) Which compound has the higher boiling point? Justify your answer. The type(s) of intermolecular force(s) in both substances should be included in your answer.

(b) At <math alttext="400 kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>400</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> both compounds are gases. At this temperature, which compound, <math alttext="C H 4, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="C C l 4, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, behaves more like an ideal gas? Justify your answer, including reasoning about both molecules.

(c) <math alttext="C C l 4, liquid"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in a previously evacuated container at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>Â°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and some of the <math alttext="C C l 4, liquid"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> evaporates. In the box below, draw a particulate diagram to show the species in the container after some of the <math alttext="C C l 4, liquid"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> has evaporated. The phases of the species should be indicated by the spacing and distribution of the particles in the diagram. Some of the species shown in the legend will not be used.

skill.text: 3.C: Represent visually the relationship between the structures and interactions across multiple levels or scales (e.g., particulate to macroscopic).
